intro: Parakeelya granulifera, commonly known as the granular parakeelya, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in moist forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
